perturbation.original_text: "Subscriber" means any individual who purchases mobile content programming and: (a) who actually pays the applicable Subscription Fee; and (b) does not receive a refund of such Subscription Fee for any reason within thirty (30) days from the end of the payment period for which the Subscription Fee was paid. A Subscriber remains a "Subscriber" for the purposes of this Agreement so long as such individual continues to pay the applicable Subscription Fee.
perturbation.changed_text: "Subscriber" means any individual who initiates the download of mobile content programming, regardless of whether a Subscription Fee is paid. A 'Subscriber' may be someone accessing free promotional content. A 'Subscriber' remains a 'Subscriber' for the purposes of this Agreement for the duration of their access to the programming.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Subscriber' requires payment of a subscription fee and no refund within 30 days. The modified definition broadens this to include anyone who downloads content, even without payment, creating a contradiction. This affects revenue calculations and access rights.

perturbation.original_text: Programming"means IMNTV's Content, as specifically described on Section B (1) of the Agreement. As used herein, "Programming" also includes any promotional and marketing Content provided by Provider for IMNTV's promotional and marketing activities as described herein.
perturbation.changed_text: "Programming" means solely the core music video content created and owned by IMNTV as specified in Exhibit B, excluding any promotional or marketing material. 'Programming' does NOT include any content that may be used for advertising or affiliate purposes.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition includes both core content and promotional material. The modified definition explicitly excludes promotional and marketing material, creating a contradiction. This affects the scope of content IMNTV is obligated to provide and Distributor is licensed to use.

perturbation.original_text:
6.1 Mobile Product Payments. Subscription fee in Territory is to be determined based on market research performed by Distributor with pricing to be agreed upon jointly and in writing Each quarter, Distributor will make royalty payments to IMNTV based on a Structure as follows:

55% of subscriber revenue for the subscription based services broadcasting IMNTV content only, net of telecom percentage provided in accordance with this Agreement.   ("Programming Payments"), subject to the following: The parties acknowledge that some mobile carriers may bill end users for a full month in a single billing, and that others may bill for partial months or pro-rate the billing of Recurring Subscribers. For each full month of Fees received from a Recurring Subscriber, Distributor will pay IMNTV based on the Rate Structure (the "Full Month Payment"). To the extent that Distributor receives a partial month's Fee or pro-rated Fee from a Recurring Subscriber as a result of a carrier's billing practices, Distributor will pay IMNTV a proportionate or pro-rated portion of such Full Month Payment based on the amount received by Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1 Mobile Product Payments. Distributor retains full discretion over Subscription Fee pricing, without requiring joint agreement with IMNTV. Distributor will make royalty payments to IMNTV based on a structure as follows: A fixed fee of $0.01 per subscriber per month, regardless of actual subscriber revenue, is owed to IMNTV. Telecom percentages are to be borne solely by IMNTV. Distributor is not responsible for fees received from Recurring Subscribers, but must pay based on raw subscriber numbers.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies a 55% revenue share to IMNTV, based on jointly agreed pricing and net of telecom percentages. The changed clause gives Distributor full control of pricing and changes the payment structure to a fixed fee of $0.01 per subscriber, with IMNTV bearing telecom percentages. This drastically alters the financial obligations and creates a direct conflict regarding revenue sharing and pricing control.
